page.title: 04AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE 2
page.content: When the students leave they are 19 or 20 years old. They{work 38 to 40 {hours a week,}but in the hay-making season they work an extra 19 or 20 hours a week. The full course is{two and a half {years}long. There are{fifteen full time staff}and {six part time staff.}There are eight workers for the livestock, which consists of{sheep, cattle and pigs. They work for five days a week. Most of the students come from {Hereford, Worcester and Holme Lacy. They do not have to take an entrance exam to go to the college, and do not do any experiments on animals. {The College is self-supporting. }It spends about Â£220,000 a year, and earns about the same, mostly from the sales of{milk, crops, and animals}to major companies.
